result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of misdemeanor court costs in this file, relative to Count 2.
-Comply with all conditions of probation in this file relative to Count 2, as well as to the probation ordered in 22CM153.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Rae Akervik

records.addlTxt:
2:09 PM Defendant Amanda Rae Akervik in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Amanda Rae Akervik.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that in 22CF194 defendant to enter into a DJOC. For Count 2, a withheld sentence for two years probation. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay mandatory court costs. In 22CM153, withheld sentence for two years probation. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, pay restitution in amount of $831.19 and pay mandatory court costs. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights she is waiving by her plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. For Count 1 in 22CF194, the Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement.   

Court imposes for in 22CF194, Count 1 a DJOC. For Count 2, a withheld sentence for two years probation. Concurrent to 22CM153. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, serve two days jail with credit for two days and pay mandatory court costs. In 22CM153, withheld sentence for two years probation. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, serve two days jail with credit for two days served, pay restitution in amount of $831.19 and pay mandatory court costs.
